title: The West Wing will shift from Netflix to the HBO Max when the streaming service launches next year
text:
Another wildly popular TV series is slated to leave Netflix, with the NBC drama The West Wing shifting to HBO Max when it launches next year.

Deadline reports that The West Wing shift was announced by WarnerMedia Chairman Bob Greenblatt during his keynote address at MIPCOM in Cannes.

The West Wing joins other hit shows such as Friends, which was brought over from Netflix, and The Big Bang Theory in the HBO Max streaming family.

HBO shift: Another wildly popular TV series is slated to leave Netflix, with the NBC drama The West Wing shifting to HBO Max when it launches next year

Streaming service: Deadline reports that The West Wing shift was announced by WarnerMedia Chairman Bob Greenblatt during his keynote address at MIPCOM in Cannes

The West Wing, created by Aaron Sorkin, aired for seven seasons between 1999 to 2006, following the exploits of U.S. President Jed Bartlett (Martin Sheen) and his White House staffers.

The series, which also starred John Spencer, Bradley Whitford, Janel Moloney, Richard Schiff, Dule Hill, NiCole Robinson, Melissa Fitzgerald and Rob Lowe.

The West Wing won nine Emmy Awards its first season on the air, the most for a series in its first season on the air.

Hit show: The West Wing, created by Aaron Sorkin, aired for seven seasons between 1999 to 2006, following the exploits of U.S. President Jed Bartlett (Martin Sheen) and his White House staffers

The show won the coveted Outstanding Drama Series for its first four seasons, and its 26 Emmy wins tied for the most ever Drama series wins with Hill Street Blues, before it was broken by Game of Thrones' 35 Emmy wins.

During his MIPCOM address, Greenblatt acknowledged that acquiring hit shows like The West Wing is a high priority for HBO Max.

'We know people come to these platforms for different reasons,' he said. 'Acquisitions are a great driver. We are looking at acquiring shows and mining our library — there’s thousands of titles in those libraries.'

TV President: The show won the coveted Outstanding Drama Series for its first four seasons, and its 26 Emmy wins tied for the most ever Drama series wins with Hill Street Blues, before it was broken by Game of Thrones' 35 Emmy wins

'HBO is the great brand of all time in our opinion,' he said. 'People know it for its excellence.'

'This year alone has been another extraordinary year, so there’s no plans to do anything but to keep that intact,' he added.

'The shows are made very carefully. There’s a certain number that is comfortable and we’re increasing slightly, but nothing to be alarmed about. To build the new platform, we’re adding new programming. We’re not taxing HBO to do anything other than what they do. It’s not going to be significant,' Greenblatt said.

All time: 'HBO is the great brand of all time in our opinion,' he said. 'People know it for its excellence'

While the show has been off the air for 13 years, the show is still quite beloved by its fans around the world.

The cast reunited at the ATX Festival in 2016 to celebrate the 10th Anniversary of the series finale.

They also reunited in 2018 to film a PSA on voting rights, and also for a reading of All the President's Men.
description: Another wildly popular TV series is slated to leave Netflix, with the NBC drama The West Wing shifting to HBO Max when it launches next year.
